description.narrative: - Industrialization and private sector development in Mali, Senegal and CI: The Project will support a local sponsor who is contributing to industrialization of the region. The success of the Project would create backward linkages with suppliers and forward linkages with local wholesalers/retailers (who sell GRIMAS' soft drinks) many of which are MSMEs. - Employment: The Project will create local employment, direct and indirect through the supply chain. - Import Substitution: Currently some of beverages/preforms/caps/gas consumed in the region are imported (especially in CI and in Senegal). The increase of local production with local brands would enable import replacement. - Government Revenues: The overall Project will contribute to public revenues through increased taxes paid by GRIMAS as well as those paid by suppliers and other downstream service providers (i.e. distributors, etc.).

Groupe Industriel Madiou Simpara SA (GRIMAS or the Company), is a producer of carbonated soft drinks, performs and caps for PET beverage bottles, and carbon dioxide for beverages. The proposed project will (i) expand its existing operations in Mali and (ii) create new operations in Cote dIvoire and Senegal. The purpose of the project is to increase the Companys revenue and market, and create a leading regional beverage group.

name.narrative:
There are four different project sites:
The NBB, HPML and Santigila factories are located at the existing GRIMAS factory site just outside Bamako in Mali. The site is on a major regional road, Route de Koulikoro, adjacent to the small village of Nyabakoro Droit. HPSN is a greenfield site located on Route Nationale 1, a major regional road in an industrial part of Rufisque, a well-developed town about 40 km from Dakar in Senegal. NBCI is located at an existing partially-completed factory site in Bonoua, a well-developed town about 56 km from Abidjan in Cote dIvoire. The site is on a major regional road and is adjacent to a mineral water bottling plant. HPCI is located in an existing factory in Zone II, a well-developed industrial area in Abidjan, Cote dIvoire.
All sites have good access to major transport routes.
